feed.title: SAP Community - SAP Datasphere

entry.title: How to send Data (Integration) from SAP Datasphere to SAP GRDC for public cloud.
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

How to send Data (Integration) from SAP Datasphere to SAP GRDC for public cloud.

Please share the exact document or related video for the same.

If we have to create Communication User,System,arrangement then please let us know which details we have to enter in (Host,inbound communication,out bound communication).

Note : Our Datasphere is not on BTP, its under BDC.

Thanks,

Ahmed

entry.title: Connecting Datasphere to Salesforce using Generic HTTP connection and API Task
entry.content:
Hi All,

We are trying to connect to Salesforce using the Generic HTTP connection along with the API Task feature. We have confirmed by sending request through Postman that access token is getting generated successfully using the same connection details as configured in the Generic HTTP connection shown in the below screenshot:

But while using the same connection in API Task to connect to Salesforce we are getting "Failed to fetch the access token" error while doing a API Test Run. We are using the following Generic API settings within the API Task:

Would like to know if anything needs to be done differently to make the API Task function as expected.

Regards,

DS

entry.title: SAC Addin with Datasphere Models: Potential problems with table data?
entry.content:
Dear DSP&SAC Addin users,

I've got a - maybe - strange question... but a client of mine hestitates in applying this solution for a time dimension view, where about 20 analytic models are affected (due to association in the underlying fact views).

He claims that on previous changes/updates in the analytic models, several of their Excel reports, created with the SAC Addin (not AO SAC Edition) would be corrupt and could no longer be used.

I tried to find answers here in the community and in SAP for me, but it seems nobody else reported such an issue.

Of course, I can imagine, that if you remove a dimension (or associated attribute view) in the fact view & Analytic model that this is no longer available in the Excel table ... but does this really cause the failure of using it? Would not a "Refresh" of the data source display the remaining table data like before, just without this attribute?

Would also added dimensions or attributes (in fact or AM) have any negative effect on the SAC Addin table in Excel?

Unfortunately I took over support only recently, since the internal colleauge left the company. So, I have no proof for this, so far.

I'm looking forward to your experiences.

BR, Martin

entry.title: SAC Data Analyzer - update data source after changes
entry.content:
Hi Community

I'm facing the issue where I have a saved analysis in SAP Analytics Cloud  data analyzer, and after we've made changes to the analytical data model in SAP Datasphere it does not return any data. Only after resetting the data source does it return data. The problem is that the reset action also resets all the actions that you've performed (selections, filtering, drill etc) in data analyzer. Is there any way to update the data source without loosing all the work you've done?

Thanks

entry.title: Clarification on Time Travel and Data Retention capabilities in SAP Datasphere
entry.content:
Hello SAP Support,

We are currently evaluating data lifecycle and governance features in SAP Datasphere and need clarification on the following points:

Does SAP Datasphere support time travel (i.e., point-in-time queries on data objects similar to historical snapshots in other data platforms)?

If not currently available, is this feature on the roadmap?

entry.title: Extracting SAP S/4HANA Data (Tables & CDS Views) to External Storages
entry.content:
Hey

I’m looking into options for extracting data from SAP S/4HANA (tables and CDS views) into external, non-SAP storages such as AWS S3 / Redshift or Oracle.

So far, I see a few directions, but I couldn’t find a clear statement on SAP’s official strategy for:

  • SAP-native options
  • Third-party tools (how does SAP position ETL tools such as Informatica or Theobald? Are those SAP-certified?)
  • SAP’s current position on BDC? Specifically Datasphere, which could also be used for data replication to an external target database?

Any references (SAP Notes, blogs, architecture guides, or project experience) would be very helpful.

entry.title: RSS Feed for SAP datasphere Blogs and Q&A
entry.content:
Dear Datasphere Experts,

Could you please help me, how to get the RSS Feed link for

SAP Datasphere Blogs and SAP Datasphere Q&A.

As of now, i am able to get RSS feed for a each Blog in datasphere. If anybody is posting a new blog in Datasphere, I should get that content in my outlook under RSS Feed.  It will be great, if you provide the steps to get the RSS Link.

Thanks.

entry.title: Taking and storing snapshots within Datasphere itself
entry.content:
Is there a way to take and store a snapshot of a view within Datasphere?

We have a remote source system upon which we cannot implement real-time replication. We therefore have a schedule to refresh the data periodically.

We then have a series of complex SQL views built on top that produce the models.

We have a requirement to provide a snapshot of the data at 6am each day, which can then be compared to the "live" version on-demand, within the same SAC dashboard.

Is there a way to create an extract from the fact view and store it in a local table based on a task, or another suitable option?
I have searched and came across the following passing comment on learning.sap.com:
"Views transform the data at the moment they are read without storing the result (although storing the view result as a snapshot is possible)", but it doesn't explain how.

entry.title: Datasphere: Reading/Storing User Prompt Input
entry.content:
Hello,

I would like to store a user's prompt selections on an Analytic Model, in a table for later use. I tried doing that via a SQL View without success using both an 'insert' statement directly as well as wrapping the insert in an 'exec', but the system seems to treat them as read-only procedures and throws an error. I understand the security reasons behind that and it makes sense,. What I have noticed, however, is that upon refreshing a view with Input Parameters, the values that are entered at first, remain as default values for the reprompt. This leads me to think that these values are cached somewhere. Does anyone know if there is a system table that stores the current session cache or something like that where I can read the prompt selections from? Or is this entirely cached by the browser?

Regards,

Dimitar

entry.title: S/4HANA to Palantir
entry.content:
Hi Team,

We are planning to extract data from S/4HANA to palantir for reporting. 

We could not find any relevant documents if we can directly integrate S/4HANA with Palantir or we should route it through datasphere.

Could you please provide us the documentation?

Best,

Chetan

entry.title: Histroy crashing after model replacement
entry.content:
Hello,

We are having this issue with a history in SAP Analytics Cloud, i will describe it in bullets for better understanding:

  1. We developed a analytic model in sap datasphere in a space called QA
  2. Then we made a history in SAP Analytics Cloud that consumes that analytic model in QA, everything is working correctly.
  3. We made a package of the analytic model in QA and imported it into another space called PRD
  4. Then we try replacing the model of the SAP Analytics Cloud history from the model in the space QA to the new model in the space PRD, but when we do this, we get this error:

    And everything crashes, nothing loads, and the web jus collapse.

  5. We tried making a fresh history with nothing in it and consuming the new model in the space PRD and that works fine

  6.  We tried making a fresh history with nothing in it and consuming the new model in the space QA and then replace it with the PRD model and that worked fine too.

  7. We also try erasing the analytic model in prd and all its pipeline, and then make a fresh package and import it again, but it doesn't work.

Thank in advance for your suggestions.

entry.title: on S/4HANA, if I use ADT to create custom CDS views, is it keeping the core clean?
entry.content:
Using ADT, if I were to create custom CDS views in S/4HANA on PCE or in S/4HANA on premise so I can create custom data products in SAP BDC, am I still keeping the core clean?   

Thanks.

Regards,

Mel Calucin

entry.title: How to connect and replicate custom tables from SAP BTP to SAP Datasphere
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

Could you please suggest the best approach to connect and replicate the custom tables data from SAP BTP to SAP Datasphere.

  • Details are below: 
    - Multiple custom tables are built on SAP BTP ABAP
    - Integration or which connection type between SAP BTP ABAP and SAP Datasphere is preferred or best
    - What are the supported Data replication Methods (real time or batch)

Use case: Reporting need
SAP BTP ABAP - Custom tables --> SAP Datasphere --> SAP SAC - Reporting

Kindly provide the inputs. Thank you.
--
BR, KRPK

SAP Datasphere SAP BTP ABAP environment

entry.title: Retrieve data from SAP datasphere using OData API (for system integration)
entry.content:
Hi,

I am trying to retrieve data from SAP datasphere using its OData API. My usecase is "I have an application ABC who wants to retrieve data from SAP data sphere views/models using OData API capability."

I am using postman for my POC/testing purpose. I have read through the below blog How to setup Postman for consuming SAP DATASPHERE ... - SAP Community and is successfully able to retrieve data by creating OAuth2 client for "Interactive Usage" purpose. But my issue with this approach is this token is able to access data from any OData API from any space. I want to restrict access to specific space only.

So I thought may be I should use "Technical User" while creating OAUth client. I have also created a scoped role, given access to required space and added this role to oauth client while creating it.

In postman, I used grant type as client credentials, used oauth2SAML token url of datasphere in !Access Token URL" below,  entered ID & secret and generated a toke, it was successful. But using this token as well I am able to retrieve data from any space. Looks like the scoped role didn't work. 

Can you please help me where I have gone wrong? is it even right way to do it when an application wants to integrate with DSP?

SAP Datasphere OData 

@Matthew_Shaw 

@Ian_Henry  @RichT @shubham521 

 

Thanks in advance.

Regards

Sandy

entry.title: ODP Extractors from S/4 HANA Not Visible in Datasphere Replication Flow (Valid ABAP Connection)
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

We are facing an issue while setting up replication flows in SAP Datasphere.
Although the ABAP connection to our S/4HANA system is successful and valid, the ODP extractors are not appearing in Datasphere replication flow

Issue:

  • In Datasphere → Replication Flow → when selecting Source Objects, ODP extractors are not listed.

  • Verified that standard extractors (e.g., 2LIS*) exist in source system and extraction enabled.

  • Connection test in datasphere shows no errors - replication flow enabled.

 

Kindly help to resolve the issue

entry.title: SAP BDC Trial System takes long time for setup
entry.content:
Am trying to get hands on with SAP BDC trial system SAP Business Data Cloud . When I registered for the same,  I always get the message displayed as We're still setting up your environment. Please try again in about 5 minutes."

Link of Business Data Cloud trial is : https://trials.cfapps.eu10-004.hana.ondemand.com/index.html?page=6

I waited for one whole day and still it shows the same. Has anyone faced similar issue? Any solution for this?

entry.title: Data Builder missing in datasphere basic trial
entry.content: starting this week Data Builder missing in datasphere basic trial

entry.title: How to recover missing documents in datasphere replication flow without having to reinitialize
entry.content:
Hi 

I was wondering if it is possible to recover missing documents when replicating data from SAP ECC to SAP datasphere via SLT without having to do initial load again. I was informed that some accounting documents were missing for certain days.  Upon investigation, I found that the missing documents wasn't transferred due to error message "Transferring delta data failed due to the following error: An exception was raised / System failure." 

We are running the replication flow every minute so it will be hard to see the error if it happens and we want  to avoid doing initial load every time to fix it.

Thanks,

B

entry.title: Integrating SAP ECC with Snowflake using SAP Datasphere as a pass-through
entry.content:
Hi Experts, 

We have a requirement to use SAP Datasphere as a pass-through layer for integrating SAP ECC data into Snowflake, and we are seeking help and guidance from the community/SAP experts.

Details are below,

Landscape

  • Source: SAP ECC 6.0 EHP7 (Oracle DB)

  • Target: Snowflake

  • Middleware: SAP Datasphere (as pass-through, since tenant isn’t available in UAE region)

  • License: SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC) already procured

Requirement

  • Leverage existing ECC extractors to ingest ECC data into Snowflake through Datasphere.

Approaches identified

  1. ABAP Connection + DMIS add-on → Enable ODP extractors & Replication Flows → Datasphere → ADLS → Snowflake

  2. ECC Connection exposing ODP extractors via Remote Tables → Datasphere → Azure Data Factory → ADLS → Snowflake

Open Questions 

  1. Can BW Bridge be used only as pass-through (without staging) to expose ECC data directly to Snowflake?

  2. Any recommendations or best practices to expose ECC 6.0 EHP7 (Oracle DB) data to 3rd-party applications like Snowflake?

  3. Do you foresee any challenges or limitations with the above proposed solutions?

Looking forward to inputs from SAP and community experts who have dealt with similar SAP-to-Snowflake integration scenarios.

entry.title: Starting Process chains in BW Bridge from Datasphere Taskchains
entry.content:
Hi all,

As mentioned above we would like to start process in our BW Bridge using Datasphere taskchains. We followed the steps in following help page and note

Help page: Configure OpenID Authentication in SAP BW Bridge | SAP Help Portal

Note: 3536298 - Usage of SAP BW Bridge OIDC Configuration in SAP Datasphere Task Chains and Catalog Metadata Extraction - SAP for Me

We are able to add out process chains to task chains now, however the actual run keeps failing with following error: 

However, we found no further information on how to solve this issue, has anyone encountered this before? 

SAP Datasphere
